abstract: The F.D.I.C. said it would sell about $4.5 billion of troubled real estate loans seized from Corus Bancshares to a group of private investment firms led by the Starwood Capital Group.
snippet: The F.D.I.C. said it would sell about $4.5 billion of troubled real estate loans seized from Corus Bancshares to a group of private investment firms led by the Starwood Capital Group.
lead_paragraph: Update | 7:29 p.m. The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation said late Tuesday that it would sell about $4.5 billion of troubled real estate loans that it recently seized from Corus Bancshares to a group of private investment firms led by the Starwood Capital Group, the real estate development company run by Barry Sternlicht.

headline.main: Starwood Group Strikes Deal for Corus Assets
